text: Even the younger members of the Ice Court are looked to for strategic decisions which older, more experienced Boyars are normally tasked to make. Will she recommend the mobility of the Ungols or the power of Gospodar artillery?

A Maiden of the Ice Court is an envoy of the Tzarina, sent across the realm to serve Katarin's interests. She is also expected to stand on the battlefield, bolstering the warriors of Kislev with her magic. Where should she focus her talents?

The Tzarina is served and protected by the formidable warrior women of the Ice Guard. It is for the Witches and Maidens of the court to ensure that the bodyguards of the Ice Queen are suitably equipped.

Ice Maidens are dedicated attendants of the Tzarina, but also bourgeoning Sorceresses in the arcane lores of the Motherland. Some also seek out the Ice Guard to learn their martial ways as well. Should the Maiden cast or fight?

Ice Maidens are chosen in part for their steely will – a common trait in all Kislevites – but even more expected in the Tzarina's attendants. Others strengthen their bond with the Motherland by stalking across its tundra.

As well as battle magic, some Ice Maidens are granted permission to learn formidable elemental powers that have only manifested during the time the Ice Queen has reigned. But which one should this Maiden focus on?

Ice Maidens are attendants to the Tzarina, not yet as accomplished as the more powerful Ice Witches. It is the ambition of every Maiden to attain that rank, and so they will look for opportunities to improve whenever they can.

An Ice Maiden is seen as a boon and protector by the common soldiery of Kislev. How should she bolster such faith the folk have in her? By ensuring this area of the Motherland is protected or that the army can march without fear?
The Atamans of the local province require the advice of the wisest member of the Ice Court. What will she recommend? Is more income required or should the folk aim for general growth?

Being part of the Ice Court rarely means a Maiden stays solely within the Bokha Palace. They are envoys, travelling the Oblasts and beyond, using their glacial arts in the regions for the benefit of the nation. In this instance, how should the Maiden exert her influence?

Should the need to defend arise, be it herself or loyal Kislevian troops, the Ice Maiden will not shirk from such duty and shall bring her powers and wisdom to bear. Should her attention be called to battle or to the Motherland itself?

The Frost Moon is when Mannslieb rises high above its evil twin. To mark such a benign event, the Ice Court bestows an arcane gift upon a few of Kislev's warriors. But should the boon go to cavalry or infantry? The Maiden must decide.
Maidens are operatives of the Tzarina, sent across the Motherland and beyond as emissaries, but will often have ulterior agendas that must be carried out in secret, though all in service to Katarin.
The Maiden, a young neophyte of the Ice Court, must now choose the path that best serves our queen. Should she walk in the storm or through the blizzard?
The Ice Court sends its envoys to barracks and lodges of the Kislevian armies. A great respect is placed on such a visitation, as they look to the Ice Maiden for guidance.

It is tradition when Mannslieb becomes ascendant – known as the Frost Moon – an Ice Witch shall bless a regiment on battle's eve. With the Frost Moon high should it be fleet-hooved cavalry or steadfast infantry that receive this gift?
Having served the Ice Court for decades, it is time the Witch dedicated herself to one of the disciplines practised within winter's halls. Choose – storm or snow?

While all Witches of the Ice Court are exceptional Mages, there are those who also excel at the martial combat practiced by the Ice Guard, while others focus solely on their arcane talents to become the best sorceresses!
An Ice Witch has many roles outside the Ice Court, respected by Druzhina and other nobles when in their presence to advise on civic matters, or even lend their power to battle should the need arise.

The Tzarina is served and protected by the formidable warrior women of the Ice Guard. It is for the Witches and Maidens of the court to ensure that the bodyguards of the Ice Queen are suitably equipped.

Those who stoke the wrath of an Ice Witch will not merely have their hearts frozen inside their bodies, but their possessions shall become part of Kislev's treasury. The Witch should decide from where this toll is collected.
Betterment is a tenet of those that serve in the Ice Court. Even one as accomplished as a Witch is expected to continue and improve. Which area should she focus on next?

The lessons of war are taught by the Ice Witches to the Ice Guard and Druzhina who come seeking their wisdom. Which tenet of war would she recommend? The mobility of the Ungols or the steadfastness of the Gospodars?

The Ice Witch is sought to make an important strategic decision. Should the mustering army of proud Kislevites focus on their infantry or is it the  beloved horse of the Motherland which needs attention?
The Atamans of the local province require the advice of the wise Ice Witch. What will she recommend? Is more income required or should the folk aim for general growth?

Being part of the Ice Court rarely means a Witch stays solely within the Bokha Palace. They are envoys, travelling the Oblasts and beyond, using their glacial arts in the regions for the benefit of the nation. How should she disperse her talents?

While Tzarina Katarin is the undisputed mistress of Ice Lore, the Ice Witches are second only to their queen in wielding this elemental magic, so which of the mighty powers should this witch focus on?
The Ice Court sends its envoys to barracks and lodges of the Kislevian armies. A great respect is placed on such a visitation, as they look to the Ice Witch for guidance.

The Great Orthodoxy holds influence right across Kislev. Even in the Ice Court, its touch is felt and its agenda considered. The Ice Witch must decide who should receive the sovereign's favour: one of her own Frost Maidens, or a Patriarch to appease the Orthodoxy.

Many Ice Witches are stern women with an iron, unbreakable will tempered by the cold. Others still have spent time in the snow-clad tundra as much creatures of the wild as the palace. Which one is she?
